issue.title: [Dart] Begin a Dart language library
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-2631](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2631). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
as per here:

<https://github.com/apache/arrow/issues/2066>

 

Dart now has FlatBuffers !! Woow.

So lets put a basic example into Arrow to get the ball rolling

Suggest a simple Flutter client consuming a dart and golang flatbuffers type / kind.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2631?focusedCommentId=16923567) by Ramkumar KB (ramkumarkb):*
I am quite excited about the opportunities that a dart lib for Arrow can open up. A Flutter app can read the memory instead of doing JSON serialization and am assuming that this would make the app very performant.

So how does one go about creating such a lib - should I look at the JS folder and navigate around? Any tips or pointers to get started (without getting intimidated!) would be very helpful.

Thank you very much!

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2631?focusedCommentId=16932362) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
I'm closing as nobody seems to be actively working on this. Don't hesitate to ping / reopen when something is ready.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-2631?focusedCommentId=17309253) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
`[~RichardHaven]` I'm not sure why you're pinging the issue. In any case, it was closed ~1.5 years ago for lack of interest. If you're interested in working on a Dart implementation of Arrow, feel free to open a new issue and/or talk about it on the [development mailing-list](https://arrow.apache.org/community/).
